Blog.post: urlLink Date: Friday, May 14, 2004 Time: 11:00 Am Place: 146 Arts The animated fish in Pixar's Finding Nemo are colorful and varied. As part of the process of creating these characters, the shading team translates the director's vision into texture maps and software (shaders) which generate the look of the character at render time. This talk will describe a general approach for creating RenderMan character shaders and discuss techniques used to solve specific problems. About the speaker Byron Bashforth received his Bachelors and Masters in Computer Science from the University of Saskatchewan in 1996 and 1998. After joining Pixar Animation Studios in 1999 as a technical director, he has worked on Toy Story 2, Monsters Inc, For the Birds, Finding Nemo, and The Incredibles. His recent work has focused on characters and their visual development, including Finding Nemo's Dory and Gill. I think urlLink Jeb and I are planning on going. If you are going, let me know at jordoncooper AT gmail.com and we will see if we can hookup.

After the last Freehouse, a lot of people were asking me about what is next or on the flipside, is the Worship Freehouse dead? I never knew what to say. Was it dead or wasn't it. Some people who helped create it had moved on or were too busy with other things or just weren't as passionate about it anymore. Not only that but we were running up with some insurance issues and financial realities. Last week while having a Slurpee with fellow Freehouse founder Todd Peters we were talking about it and Todd started talking about the original vision for the Freehouse that he had while at Soularize in Seattle a couple of years ago. Basically for there to be a place where the theologian and artist could come together and hang out and be who God created them to be. It is a hard balancing act to do and I wonder how effective it was (I mean that in a good way because how does one evaluate that) having it in one place. We started talking about Todd passion of music and some others passion of theology and the urlLink Theology Pub . As we tossed around ideas we talked of that happening as a community and not as an event. Instead of getting musicians to play for us, what about us as a group going to listen to them play at their gigs? Instead of preparing a learning experience all of the time, why not go an take in some of the learning opportunities and lectures that Saskatoon has to offer? Todd and some others still have some ideas for some events but not as a regularily scheduled "service". I am not sure what it will look like in the end but it should be a little more organic and not as programmed, then again it will also depend on knowing what is happening in Saskatoon so if you know of something cool, let us know. As far as knowing what the Freehouse will be up to, check out the new blog and urlLink Atom feed for updates and news.
